CatDescriptText: Article accompanying image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 15, 1946, pg. 8, reads: "Parr - Gilkes Wedding is Gay Social Event - Miss Lois Marie Parr, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Parr of Singer Place, became the bride of Eresby R. Gilkes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Reginald Gilkes of Webster Avenue Saturday night in a ceremony performed by Rev. S. D. Rudder. Given in marriage by her father, the bride wore white satin with a fingertip veil.  Her bouquet was of white snapdragons and asters.  Miss Frances Parr, the bride's sister, was maid of honor and wore a gown of pink brocade.  Harold Slater was best man.  Following a honeymoon in Philadelphia and New York, the young couple will reside at 3411 Webster Avenue.  Attending the wedding was Mrs. Leon Beverly, sister of the bride, who flew down from New York for the ceremony."
TitMainTitle: Groom Eresby R. Gilkes wearing tuxedo, and bride Lois Marie Parr Gilkes wearing satin wedding gown with long sleeves, square neckline, and long veil, holding bouquet of snapdragons and asters, standing in domestic interior with fireplace, ferns, and palms
